definition: Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
falcon/migratory bird

sentences.english: In 840, large numbers of Uighurs (an ancient name for modern Uygurs) entered Xinjiang.
sentences.chinese: 公元840年，大批回鹘人进入新疆。

sentences.english: The Gaochang Huihu (Uygurs) once figured in stage of history.
sentences.chinese: 高昌回鹘曾一度活跃于历史舞台。

sentences.english: West of its activities in the Congling known to history as Congling West Uighur.
sentences.chinese: 因其活动于葱岭以西，史称葱岭西回鹘。

sentences.english: There are upside-down scripts in Uygur writings, usually on the backside of the paper.
sentences.chinese: 回鹘文契约中有倒写文字，常见于纸背。

sentences.english: Historians are now studying the history of Huihu.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家正在研究回鹘的历史。

definition: Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Turkic ethnic group
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Qarluq or Karluk nomadic tribe, a Turkic ethnic minority in ancient times
ancient Central Asian city state, flourished in first millennium AD, in modern Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
khanate (Mongol state)
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Nanzhao kingdom 738-937 in southwest China and southeast Asia
khan (loanword)
tent of the commanding officer/tent capital of a nomadic people
